Scala.name: Scala programming language
Scala.description: A functional and object-oriented programming language built upon the Java Virtual Machine (JVM).

Java virtual machine.name: Java virtual machine
Java virtual machine.description: A virtual machine for running Java programs. Many other languages, such as Scala, compile programs into Java bytecode so that they can run on the Java virtual machine.

Apache Maven.name: Apache Maven
Apache Maven.description: A software packaging system for Java and Scala packages.

Coursier.name: Coursier
Coursier.description: A tool for running Java virtual machine programs directly from Apache Maven repositories.

Java Swing.name: Java Swing
Java Swing.description: A graphical user interface (GUI) library for Java.

JavaScript.name: JavaScript programming language
JavaScript.description: A programming language often used to add interactivity to websites, but also capable of being used for any purpose through the Node.js runtime.

NPM.name: NPM
NPM.description: A package manager for the JavaScript programming language.

caDSR.name: Cancer Data Standards Registry and Repository
caDSR.description: A database of field definitions used in cancer data.

UMLS.name: Unified Medical Language System
UMLS.description: A database of mappings between multiple medical vocabularies.

RDF.name: Resource Description Framework
RDF.description: A simple and flexible data model that forms the basis of technologies such as OWL.

Web Ontology Language.name: Web Ontology Language
Web Ontology Language.description: An RDF-based language for authoring ontologies.

Ontologies.name: Ontologies
Ontologies.description: An ontology is a formal representation of knowledge.

SHACL.name: Shapes Constraint Language
SHACL.description: A W3 specification for describing and validating graph-based data.

ShEx.name: Shape Expressions
ShEx.description: A W3 specification for describing and validating graph-based data.

PFB.name: Portable Format for Biomedical data
PFB.description: An Apache Avro-based format for publishing biomedical data.

CEDAR Workbench.name: CEDAR Workbench
CEDAR Workbench.description: A software tool and associated formats for collecting and validating medical metadata.

SSSOM.name: A Simple Standard for Sharing Ontology Mappings
SSSOM.description: A simple TSV-based format for sharing mappings between concepts in different ontologies.

Slurm Workload Manager.name: Slurm Workload Manager
Slurm Workload Manager.description: A tool for managing jobs on a computer cluster.

Software testing.name: Software testing
Software testing.description: Software tools and techniques used to test whether other software tools are functioning correctly.

web APIs.name: web APIs
web APIs.description: Any application programming interface (API) designed to be used over the World Wide Web, usually via the HTTP protocol.
